title: 115_hr3541
content: The Act is named the "Sexual Assault Forensic Evidence Reporting Act of 2017" or the "SAFER Act of 2017." It includes best practices for retaining rape kits for unsolved crimes. The Justice for All Act of 2004 is amended to include the Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance and other subject matter experts in encouraging compliance with established guidelines for cases without convictions. The Justice for All Act of 2004 is amended to include deadlines for publishing and reviewing best practices for the preservation of sexual assault evidence collection kits in unsolved cases. The Justice for All Act of 2004 is amended to update best practices for sexual assault evidence collection kits and rights of survivors under title 18, United States Code. SEC. 3. PEDIATRIC SEXUAL ASSAULT NURSE EXAMINERS. Amends the DNA Sexual Assault Justice Act of 2004 to include the role of forensic nurses in responding to abuse of children and adolescents, emphasizing the need for pediatric sexual assault nurse examiners. The Debbie Smith DNA Backlog Grant Program is amended to increase the capacity of State and local prosecution offices to address the backlog of violent crime cases with suspects identified through DNA evidence. Grant awards for prosecutors will allocate not less than 5 percent, but not more than 7 percent, for this purpose. The Justice for All Reauthorization Act of 2016 amends the Debbie Smith DNA Backlog Grant Program to allocate 5-7% of funds for grants to prosecutors to address the backlog of violent crime cases with suspects identified through DNA evidence. The Justice for All Reauthorization Act of 2016 allocates funds to prosecutors to address the backlog of violent crime cases with suspects identified through DNA evidence. The Justice for All Reauthorization Act of 2016 allocates funds to address the backlog of violent crime cases with suspects identified through DNA evidence by amending the DNA Analysis Backlog Elimination Act of 2000 to extend the reauthorization to 2022 and repealing the sunset provision of the SAFER Act of 2013.
